results.title: Scottish Premiership: What did we learn from the weekend's games?

results.description: Defender Michael Devlin is accidentally slapped in the face by Niall McGinn as Aberdeen celebrate their equaliser.
results.shortTitle: Watch: Devlin high-fived in the face
results.title: Michael Devlin is accidentally slapped in the face as Aberdeen celebrate their equaliser.

results.description: Aberdeen make it three wins from three despite the loss of an early goal against Ross County. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Ross County 1-3 Aberdeen

results.description: Aberdeen make it three wins from three as they move up to third in the Scottish Premiership by beating Ross County at the Global Energy Stadium.
results.shortTitle: Aberdeen beat Ross County to move third
results.title: Ross County 1-3 Aberdeen

thumbnail.altText: Aberdeen's Niall McGinn and Michael Devlin

results.description: Catch up with all the team news and stats for the six games taking place before the international break, and choose your preferred XI.
results.title: Scottish Premiership team news, stats & selectors

results.description: Ross County co-manager Steven Ferguson says his promoted side's "honeymoon period is over" after facing every team in the Scottish Premiership.
results.title: Ross County: 'Honeymoon period is over' - Steven Ferguson

results.description: Aberdeen manager Derek McInnes says there is "absolutely nothing" in reports linking him with Stoke City.
results.title: Aberdeen: Derek McInnes says 'absolutely nothing' in Stoke reports

results.description: One Aberdeen fan was keen to impress manager Derek McInnes with his heading ability during the 3-0 win over Kilmarnock.
results.shortTitle: Aberdeen fan shows off his heading skills
results.title: Mopping up at the back - of the stand - Aberdeen fan shows his heading skills

thumbnail.altText: Aberdeen fan completes fine headed clearance at Pittodrie

results.description: Curtis Main scores his first goal for Aberdeen as they ease aside Kilmarnock at Pittodrie. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Aberdeen 3-0 Kilmarnock

results.description: Aberdeen ease to victory over injury and suspension hit Kilmarnock, with Sam Cosgrove scoring his 16th goal of the season.
results.title: Aberdeen 3-0 Kilmarnock: Hosts ease to victory over makeshift visitors

results.description: Aberdeen's new £12m Cormack Park complex means they no longer need to "shy away" from discussing training facilities with potential signings, says Derek McInnes.
results.shortTitle: 'New training hub can sway potential signings'
results.title: Aberdeen finally have training facility 'to be proud of' - Derek McInnes

thumbnail.altText: Stewart Milne, Derek McInes, Dave Cormack

results.description: Sir Alex Ferguson says Aberdeen's new training facilities and football academy Cormack Park is "up there with the best" he has seen.
results.shortTitle: 'Centre can take Aberdeen to highest level'
results.title: Sir Alex Ferguson: Cormack Park can help Aberdeen to 'highest level'

results.description: Lewis Ferguson fires in the only goal as Aberdeen dominate for long spells at Hamilton Accies.
results.title: Highlights: Hamilton 0-1 Aberdeen

results.description: Aberdeen put their weekend thrashing by Celtic behind them with a 1-0 Scottish Premiership win at Hamilton Academical.
results.shortTitle: Aberdeen get back to winning ways at Hamilton
results.title: Hamilton 0-1 Aberdeen: Dons move on from Celtic thrashing

results.description: Summer signing Craig Bryson says it has been "hard to watch" on the sidelines through injury as Aberdeen have struggled for form.
results.title: Aberdeen: Craig Bryson says injury hit start at Pittodrie 'massively frustrating'

results.title: Midweek Scottish Premiership team news, stats & selectors

results.description: The "hysteria" surrounding Aberdeen's Scottish Premiership thumping by Celtic is understandable says Derek McInnes, but he insists they can bounce back.
results.title: Derek McInnes: Aberdeen boss understands fan 'hysteria' but vows to improve results

results.description: Club legend Joe Harper says Aberdeen are "in transition" but can challenge the Old Firm once they build their new stadium and training ground.
results.shortTitle: Harper calls for Aberdeen fan patience
results.title: Aberdeen: Joe Harper calls for patience with Derek McInnes and club hierarchy

results.description: Aberdeen suffer their biggest home defeat since May 2016 as Celtic run riot at Pittodrie. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Aberdeen 0-4 Celtic
